image.altText: Matthew Richardson holds up his hand

props.synopsis: Olympic cyclist Matthew Richardson responds to criticism of his defection to Great Britain after winning three medals for Australia in Paris, saying he is "just a kid chasing a dream".

title.children: West Australian Olympic medallist hits back at critics after shock defection to Great Britain

image.altText: A brunette woman in an orange jacket and black glasses sits holding a microphone

props.synopsis: A training provider says it believed the sexual harassment case study it used in a course delivered to Bunbury prison staff was fictional. In fact, it included the name and details of a former employee and current federal court complainant.

title.children: Warning AI 'hallucinates' and 'can't be relied on' after chatbot uses real information for 'fictional scenario'

image.altText: A wooden boat in the water among mangroves being approached by another small grey boat.

props.synopsis: Adrian Lane helped alert border force to the presence of multiple Indonesian fishing boats at Kuri Bay, but the Dambimangari man is frustrated more than a dozen fishers are yet to face any criminal charges.

title.children: Traditional owner who helped catch illegal fishers frustrated by lack of action

image.altText: Three older women stand on a city street looking very serious.

props.synopsis: They're known as the Joey Girls — children who ended up at a Perth orphanage after being shipped to Australia from the UK last century — and they're one of the missing puzzle pieces in the story of WA's forced adoption era.

title.children: The children who became godmothers to babies taken from unwed mothers

image.altText: A mother holds her daughter

props.synopsis: Since 2019, birth rates have slumped by eight per cent across regional and remote WA communities. Access to childcare, housing and education are seen as potential drivers.

title.children: Why are birth rates plummeting in country Western Australia?

image.altText: Bill shorten wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The federal government has reached an agreement with the states and territories over plans to reform the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS).

title.children: States and territories to back major NDIS reforms

image.altText: A tight head and shoulders shot of Senator Linda Reynolds looking at the camera outside court.

props.synopsis: A clumsily crafted bot network posting about the Linda Reynolds and Brittany Higgins defamation trial likely originated from foreign influencers wielding culturally divisive topics to sow discord, an ABC NEWS Verify analysis finds.

title.children: Seven red flags we identified about the X accounts posting about Reynolds's defamation trial

image.altText: A woman in a tan dress looks serious.

props.synopsis: The bombshell decision of Brittany Higgins's legal team not to call the former political staffer to give evidence in her defence has shocked those following her defamation trial with Linda Reynolds. Here's what the move means for the rest of the trial.

title.children: Here's what Brittany Higgins's decision not to testify means for the Linda Reynolds defamation trial

image.altText: Generic image of a JetStar plane

props.synopsis: Jetstar faces a class action over cancelled flights during the COVID-19 pandemic, with its flight credits program under scrutiny.

title.children: Jetstar faces class action over cancelled flights during the COVID-19 pandemic

image.altText: Stephanie Grisham stands at lecturn speaking at Democratic National Convention

props.synopsis: The Democratic National Convention continues, with Barack and Michelle Obama expected to take to the stage, along with second gentleman Doug Emhoff and JFK's grandson, Jack Schlossberg. Follow live.

title.children: Trump's former press secretary tells Democratic National Convention about Republican candidate 'behind closed doors'

image.altText: A woman looks seriously at the camera

props.synopsis: Australia's progress on the national plan to end violence against women and children will be under the spotlight today. Follow live.

title.children: Report card on Australia's progress to end DV to be tabled

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Breaking: States strike deal with govt on NDIS reforms
Greens trying to move motion on Israel sanctions
Watchdog won't be a 'protection racket', Gallagher says

image.altText: Two Chinese flags flutter in the wind at a shipping port.

props.synopsis: A prolonged downturn in China's property market will have significant flow-on effects for the Australian government's finances and the local steel industry, economists warn.

title.children: BlueScope Steel warns a 'large volume of steel' is leaving China and flooding markets in Australia and overseas

image.altText: People holding a sign saying make this deal real

props.synopsis: If you believe the United States, then Israel and Hamas are close to reaching a ceasefire deal to end the fighting in Gaza. But that's not what both parties are saying.

title.children: Has Hamas really rejected a Gaza ceasefire deal, and has Israel really accepted it? Not exactly

image.altText: A younger woman's hand holding an elderly patient's hand.

props.synopsis: The federal government is close to unveiling its plans for older Australians to pay more for their aged care, after months of closed-door negotiations with the Coalition.

title.children: Aged care residents to pay more as government grapples with quality and quantity

image.altText: A composite image showing a small black beetle next to a tree stump with tunneling damage.

props.synopsis: The invasive shot-hole borer beetle has been found outside Perth's quarantine zone, sparking fears it could spread to the east coast.

title.children: Invasive shot-hole-borer pest killing mature trees breaches Perth quarantine zone

image.altText: Three miners in hi-vis workwear walking out of yellow lift pointing to a crowd.

props.synopsis: For a fortnight, Todd Russell and Brant Webb lay side-by-side, trapped in a small dark space, after a mine collapse. Until the last minute, they were never certain they'd survive.

title.children: A miner survived 14 days trapped underground. When he got out, he was not prepared for becoming a household name

image.altText: Mike Lynch smiles as he wears a suit and walks from the High Court.

props.synopsis: Their Italian holiday was meant to celebrate winning a mighty battle between corporate heavyweights, but the Bayesian luxury yacht was in "the wrong place at the wrong time".

title.children: A freak ocean phenomenon is being blamed for the sudden sinking of the luxury yacht Bayesian

image.altText: A drone image shows a bridge that has been severely damaged.

props.synopsis: Over four days, all three bridges over the Seym River in Kursk were either destroyed or damaged, as Ukraine's incursion into Russian territory enters its third week.

title.children: Why is Ukraine destroying bridges in Russia's Kursk region?

image.altText: A bald man wearing glasses and a suit gestures passionately.

props.synopsis: Not 10 days on from Australia's most senior spy advising politicians of all stripes to be milder with their language, the parliament has bunged on a multidirectional slapfest that wouldn't be out of place on the Jerry Springer show.

title.children: A loud and unnecessary immigration brawl is obscuring a deeper and genuinely alarming question

image.altText: a woman and dog look into each other's eyes

props.synopsis: Desperate to ease the agony she was in and regain her quality of life, Inez made the heartbreaking choice to lose her fertility. It might not even help.

title.children: Inez had a hysterectomy at 27 for the chance of a pain-free life. The devastating catch is it might not help

image.altText: A photograph of a streetscape in the central business district of regional city Kalgoorlie.

props.synopsis: City of Kalgoorlie-Boulder councillors vote against the introduction of unrestricted trading hours but agree to extend retail hours.

title.children: Historic mining city votes against introducing unrestricted trading hours

image.altText: a computer-generated image of a solar farm and high-powered electricity lines.

props.synopsis: SunCable's Australia-Asia Power Link project in the remote Northern Territory has received crucial approval from the Commonwealth government.

title.children: SunCable receives environmental approval from Albanese government for Australia-Asia Power Link

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Australian share market falls slightly as its week-long rally runs out of steam, while IAG's insurance profit jumps 79 per cent, and gold hits a new record high on increasing bets of a US interest rate cut next month. Follow live.

title.children: Jetstar faces 'COVID credits' class action, ASX slips and IAG's insurance profit surges 79pc

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Jetstar will review claims in class action filing
SunCable receives environmental approval from Albanese government for Australia-Asia Power Link

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek sists smiling with her hand on her chin looking towards Anthony Albanese who is looking at a phone.

props.synopsis: Australia is soon to host an international "nature positive" summit, but the federal government can't get its own "nature positive" laws through parliament.

title.children: Overhaul of environmental laws looks shaky, with more delays and disagreements pushing back reform

image.altText: A woman shopping for groceries.

props.synopsis: National and state-based committees have been tasked with looking into supermarket prices across the country. But with costs continuing to outweigh inflation, whether they'll have an impact remains to be seen.

title.children: Despite multiple supermarket inquiries, Australians are struggling to keep pace with prices

image.altText: A box of packaged returned items is emptied by a woman onto a table.

props.synopsis: Plus-sized lingerie website Curvy is one of many online retailers pulling back on delivery incentives, with data showing fewer businesses are offering free shipping compared to six years ago.

title.children: The age of free returns is over as online retailers recoup more delivery costs

image.altText: Jannik Sinner prepares to hit a forehand

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios slams an independent tribunal's decision to clear Australian Open champion Jannik Sinner of wrongdoing after he failed two doping tests earlier this year.

title.children: 'Ridiculous': Kyrgios hits out after world number one Sinner avoids doping ban

image.altText: MPs in parliament

props.synopsis: The federal government will be unveiling new laws to increase consequences for politicians and members of staff that engage in bad behaviour.

title.children: New legislation unveiled to increase consequences for MPs who engage in bad behaviour

image.altText: A microscopic photo of pink bacteria swarming together

props.synopsis: Over the last three decades, legionnaires' disease has grown in Australia, particularly in NSW where cases have increased by over 600 per cent. Scientists aren't certain why, but they have theories.

title.children: Why is this 'first-world disease' becoming more common? Scientists aren’t certain

image.altText: A collage of Bluesfest 2025 acts Crowded House, Gary Clark Jr., Allison Russell, Tones And I, Vance Joy and Fanny Lumsden

props.synopsis: Bluesfest is ending in 2025. Here are the first 20 acts locked in to help send off the long-running Easter event in style.

title.children: Crowded House leads Bluesfest's final ever line-up

image.altText: A young black girl in a white cardigan and her eyes squeezed shut embraces her father

props.synopsis: Filmmaker Natalie Rae and activist Angela Patton's film Daughters follows four girls who are reunited with their incarcerated fathers through a program called Date with Dad.

title.children: Get ready to weep watching this moving doco about a daddy-daughter dance in a US prison

image.altText: An old, rusted orange and brown coin held in the hand of a man.

props.synopsis: A father and son duo found a pre-colonial coin while prospecting and knew immediately they had found something special.

title.children: 'Like hens' teeth': Detectorist unearths pre-colonial Dutch coin in Tasmania
